Choice Scarf allows Tapu Fini to outspeed a vast majority of the metagame with the exception of Regieleki and to often perform a useful role for the team. This may include dealing a good amount of damage to faster, but weaker Pokemon such as Cinderace, using Trick to lock the opponents into a single move, or using Soak to support team members such as Zapdos and Rillaboom and often help them take a KO. Choice Specs is used on fully offensive Tapu Fini, and its damage can be devastating to unprepared teams. These both, however, come at the risk of locking Tapu Fini into a single move for extended periods of time unless it switches, which often detracts from the versatility it usually provides.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description:
• Moonblast is Tapu Fini's primary attacking move, hitting Pokemon such as Grimmsnarl, Galarian Moltres, and Urshifu-S for super effective damage and offers a chance to drop the foe's Special Attack.

  • Muddy Water is often the preferred Water-type STAB move for Tapu Fini, as it is an effective spread option that can swing games with the chance to lower both opposing Pokemon's Accuracy. After a Calm Mind boost, it can also serve as a powerful base move for Max Geyser.

  • Calm Mind allows Tapu Fini to survive Modest Magnet Regieleki's Thunderbolt and then KO it in return with Moonblast with just a single boost, as well as generally putting it at an advantage late-game with its raised Special Attack.

  • Calm Mind Tapu Fini often needs a source of longevity due to its lack of worthwhile natural recovery. As a result, Leftovers is the primary item for Tapu Fini, as it often wants to stay on the field for longer periods of time. Its HP maximizes recovery off of a single turn of Leftovers healing . Sitrus Berry and Aguav Berry are also other options for one-time recovery, but in longer games Leftovers often gives more recovery altogether. Tapu Fini's Speed allows it to outspeed common base 100 Speed Pokemon such as Charizard and Zapdos when at +1, often from a partner's Max Airstream or Regieleki's Electroweb.

sets.name: Meteor Beam
sets.description:
• Nihilego makes use of its good Speed tier and solid offensive typing to be a potent special attacker. It can quickly accrue Special Attack boosts and start a sweep thanks to the combination of Meteor Beam and Beast Boost.

  • Meteor Beam is a powerful nuke option, capable of OHKOing Incineroar, Rotom-H, and Dynamaxed Thundurus. Power Herb is required to make sure Nihilego can use it instantly.

  • Power Gem is a back up Rock-type STAB move, letting Nihilego continuously pressure Fire- and Flying-types after it has already used Meteor Beam. Trick Room on Nihilego is normally used to reverse opposing Trick Room, but it can also support slower attackers like Glastrier and Torkoal.

sets.name: Fast Support
sets.description:
• With a decent supportive movepool, great offensive stats, and the second highest base Speed of any Pokemon in the format, Pheromosa carves a niche in the current metagame as a dangerous supportive Pokemon that can hold its own.

  • Close Combat is Pheromosa's main source of damage, being able to hit Fighting-weak Pokemon such as Incineroar and Urshifu-S for good damage. Due to Pheromosa's atrocious defenses, dropping them is very rarely relevant.

  • Speed Swap is the primary reason to use Pheromosa. It's particularly potent when paired with Pokemon that have plenty of offensive pressure but lack Speed such as Glastrier and Eruption Torkoal.

  • Coaching is a great supportive move that allows Pheromosa to substantially increase the damage output of physically attacking partners such as Glastrier, Thundurus, and Metagross.

  • Triple Axel is the Ice-type move of choice, lending itself to Pheromosa's base 137 Attack stat and maximum Attack investment which can overcome Pokemon such as Zapdos and Galarian Moltres. Icy Wind is a great form of speed control due to Pheromosa's blistering Speed; on the other hand, Ice Beam is a good move that applies heavy pressure to Landorus-T.

  • Due to Pheromosa's terrible defensive stats, Focus Sash is the only item worth running to allow Pheromosa to have multiple opportunities to perform its supportive role.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Offensive Celesteela can provide a bulky Steel-type option to any team, as well as a potent Dynamax candidate that is capable of boosting its Defense with Max Steelspike or its Speed with Max Airstream. Beast Boost can also help it become a particularly potent offensive threat when left unchecked.

  • Flash Cannon offers Celesteela a consistent way to overcome Glastrier, Grimmsnarl, and Nihilego while also providing it Max Steelspike to boost its Defense when Dynamaxed.

  • Air Slash allows Celesteela to effectively handle threats such as Urshifu-S and Venusaur while also giving it Max Airstream to boost its Speed when Dynamaxed.

  • Meteor Beam gives Celesteela access to Max Rockfall, allowing it to fire off a move that's particularly effective against Incineroar, Thundurus, and Charizard.

  • Flamethrower allows Celesteela to overcome opposing Steel-types that would resist the rest of its moveset such as Kartana and Metagross.

  • The given EV spread optimizes Celesteela's HP to be as high as possible while minimizing Life Orb recoil damage. Its Speed investment allows it to outspeed Thundurus and Kartana after a single Max Airstream.

  • Life Orb allows Celesteela to make up for its average Special Attack stat by adding some additional firepower. Safety Goggles turns it into a hard counter for Amoonguss and Venusaur, as it blocks their sleep moves.

sets.name: Leech Seed
sets.description:
• Defensive Celesteela focuses on reaching an endgame where its bulk and consistent passive recovery make it completely unbeatable against the remainder of the opposing team. Additionally, any KOs it gets allows it to further boost its Special Defense with Beast Boost.

  • Flash Cannon is Celesteela's primary source of damage, helping it overcome common Pokemon such as Grimmsnarl and Glastrier. Heavy Slam is an alternative that is capable of dealing substantial damage at a high Base Power due to Celesteela's weight, but it comes with a risk due to it failing against Dynamaxed Pokemon.

  • Leech Seed gives Celesteela another source of recovery alongside Leftovers and a consistent win condition for endgames.

  • Flamethrower is responsible for handling opposing Grass-types that would otherwise ignore Leech Seed such as Kartana and Rillaboom.

  • Celesteela's EVs grant it the best chances when dueling Pokemon such as Urshifu-S and Spectrier in endgame situations.

Kartana.overview: In a metagame dominated by Tapu Fini and Electric-types, Kartana stands out as one of the most reliable Grass-type options for any team. Its massive Attack stat coupled with high Speed and very useful Max Moves gives it the ability to tear through teams on its own. Even outside of Dynamax, Kartana's attacking prowess cannot be understated, especially once it has a Beast Boost or two under its belt. However, Kartana does possess a few downsides. However, its obvious weaknesses to Fire-types and strong special attacks often result in it getting KOed quickly.
Kartana.comments:
Other Options

Similarly to Aerial Ace, Giga Impact or Guillotine can be used as a speed control option in the form of Max Strike. However, because you are lowering the foes' Speed instead of boosting your own Pokemon's, any new Pokemon sent out onto the field will be unaffected.

sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description:
• Smart Strike is used as a secondary STAB option to hit Fairy- and Ice-types such as Grimmsnarl and Glastrier. It is also useful for access to Max Steelspike for Defense boosting.

  • Sacred Sword is Kartana's main coverage option, allowing it to hit the likes of Incineroar and Heatran. Access to Max Knuckle is also extremely helpful, as it negates Intimidate drops and can boost Kartana's Attack by two stages if it KOes an opponent.

  • Aerial Ace is used for access to Max Airstream, providing both Kartana and its partner with a Speed boost. Notably, this allows Kartana to outspeed Modest Venusaur in sun.

  • Maximum Special Defense investment coupled with an Assault Vest allows Kartana to take strong special attacks such as Galarian Moltres' Max Airstream and Regieleki's Max Lightning that it would be unable to otherwise.

sets.name: Focus Sash
sets.description:
• Smart Strike is necessary to hit the plethora of Fairy-type Pokemon in the metagame including Grimmsnarl, Whimsicott, and Clefairy, for as much damage as possible. If Kartana is Dynamaxed, the boosts to its Defense from Max Steelspike make it insanely durable physically.

  • Sacred Sword complements Kartana's Grass and Steel STAB type combo to hit Incineroar, Heatran, and Urshifu-S hard. Any KOs achieved by using Max Knuckle will also raise its Attack by two stages instead of one via Beast Boost.

  • Detect is mandatory on Focus Sash Kartana, as it is otherwise very susceptible to double targets from Fake Out and other strong special attacks such as Zapdos and Celesteela's Max Airstreams. Detect specifically is also unaffected by Imprison from Indeedee, which can only learn Protect.

  • Focus Sash allows Kartana to not worry about compensating for its low Special Defense. Therefore, it can fully invest in its Attack, which is particularly helpful for netting higher rolls on Pokemon such as Tapu Fini and Glastrier.

Stakataka.overview: Stakataka's sky high Defense and rock bottom Speed allow it to be a very unique Trick Room setter in the current metagame. Twinned with its amazing bulk, Stakataka possesses a base 131 Attack stat and a great typing that allows it to duel common Fairy-types in metagame such as Clefairy and Grimmsnarl, as well as common Flying-type threats such as Zapdos and Galarian Moltres. Beast Boost is also an exceptional ability that allows Stakataka to either snowball offensively or become a great wall in front of foes. That being said, it also has some of the worst weaknesses in the current metagame with two 4x weaknesses to Ground and Fighting. Its low Speed also makes it incredibly reliant on Trick Room to be effective, often making it require redirection support from Indeedee-F or Amoonguss.
Stakataka.comments:
Other Options

Stakataka can run alternative coverage moves such as Heat Crash and High Horsepower for dealing with opposing Steel-types such as Metagross and Heatran. However, this often means foregoing one of Stakataka's STAB moves, making it generally less effective overall.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Gyro Ball is Stakataka's primary source of damage, with its extremely low Speed allowing it to hit for full power against almost the entirety of the metagame, but it is particularly potent against Regieleki and Spectrier. It can also be used to boost its Defense even further with Max Steelspike.

  • Rock Slide is a nice STAB spread move for Stakataka that allows it to set the sand via Max Rockfall, patching up its Special Defense in the process. It is also the best move for Stakataka to hit Pokemon that resist Steel such as Charizard and Zapdos, which it would otherwise struggle to hit. Body Press uses Stakataka's enormous Defense stat to deal good damage to targets such as Incineroar and Ferrothorn, as well as boosting its Attack as far as 2 two stages when Dynamaxed thanks to Beast Boost. This also allows it to effectively ignore Intimidate.

  • Trick Room allows Stakataka to serve as the team's form of speed control, while also benefitting from it itself due to being the slowest Pokemon in the current metagame.

  • Protect is a consistent way to help increase the longevity of Stakataka, and it also allows it to avoid opposing Fake Out that would otherwise disrupt it from using Trick Room.

  • The use of a Lonely nature and 17 Defense IVs allows Stakataka's Beast Boost to boost its Attack rather than its Defense.

  • Shuca Berry helps Stakataka survive even the strongest Ground-type moves in the game such as Max Quake from Landorus-T and Garchomp. Weakness Policy exploits Stakataka's great physical bulk and common weaknesses in order to gain a +2 attack boost whereas Life Orb is a more consistent damage boost with a small amount of recoil, but these come at the cost of being more easily dealt with by these threats.

Rillaboom.overview: Rillaboom is a solid offensive pivot in the metagame due to its high Attack, excellent movepool, and amazing ability in Grassy Surge. With its strong Grass-type attacks like Grassy Glide and Wood Hammer, it can easily threaten metagame staples like Tapu Fini and Tyranitar. Additionally, it provides teams with a necessary Water-type check and solid support moves in Fake Out, Knock Off, and U-turn. However, it is hindered by its weaknesses to common Pokemon like Incineroar, Glastrier, and Thundurus. It is also crippled by Intimidate, which has a dominant presence in the metagame thanks to Landorus-T and Incineroar.
Rillaboom.comments:
Other Options

Taunt can be used on Miracle Seed sets to disrupt Amoonguss and Dusclops, which can stop Trick Room setup or Spore spam, but it is still less useful than other moves like Protect. Swords Dance can be used to further boost Rillaboom's offensive capabilities; however, it takes up a moveslot that would otherwise be used for extra coverage.

sets.name: Utility
sets.description:
• The combination of Grassy Glide and Grassy Terrain allows Rillaboom to make quick work of Pokemon like Tapu Fini and Rhyperior. When Gigantamaxed, it turns into G-Max Drum Solo, an insanely powerful STAB move.

  • U-turn allows Rillaboom to pivot into a partner Pokemon that's more suited to take advantage of the current situation.

  • Wood Hammer is a harder-hitting STAB move that can be used to hit slower Pokemon such as Porygon2 and Lapras, while Knock Off improves Rillaboom's supportive capabilities and heavily threatens Spectrier. Protect can be used to give Rillaboom extra longevity, as it can survive the turn and heal with Grassy Terrain recovery.

  • Assault Vest gives Rillaboom more durability when facing special attackers like Regieleki and Lapras, while Miracle Seed grants it access to stronger Grass-type attacks and the freedom to use status moves like Protect.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Choice Banded Rillaboom is one of the most threatening priority users in the metagame, threatening insane damage with its powerful Grassy Terrain-boosted attacks. It is typically reluctant to Dynamax to make full use of its Choice Band, but it can do so in a pinch.

  • Grassy Glide is Rillaboom's main STAB move, being easily spammable in Grassy Terrain thanks to its priority and solid power. Should Rillaboom need to Dynamax, it provides access to G-Max Drum Solo, allowing it to OHKO offensive Gigantamax Lapras.

  • Wood Hammer is a more powerful option useful for hitting slower targets like Tapu Fini and bulkier Landorus-T variants.

  • U-turn lets Rillaboom function as a hard-hitting pivot and is excellent for wearing down opposing Rillaboom.

  • High Horsepower lets Rillaboom dent Fire- and Steel-types like Incineroar and Metagross, though Superpower can hit the latter harder, as well as Kartana and Ferrothorn for super effective damage, at the cost of dropping its Attack and Defense.

  • An Adamant nature with 252 Attack EVs ensures Rillaboom can strike as hard as possible, OHKOing the likes of Tapu Fini and Urshifu-R with its Grassy Glide. A Jolly nature can be used to outspeed Adamant Landorus-T and max Speed Heatran at the cost of damage output.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Thanks to its high Attack and Speed as well as plenty of Max Moves to boost its and its partner's stats, Cinderace can be a threatening Dynamax candidate. Its wide movepool allows it to pressure numerous metagame staples such as Rillaboom, Porygon2, and Incineroar.

  • Pyro Ball is the preferred Fire-type STAB move, as it has recoil while still being quite powerful.

  • Bounce gives Cinderace access to a powerful Max Airstream, letting it boost its Speed while doing massive damage to Venusaur and Urshifu-S. Giga Impact provides similar speed control and more power in Max Strike; however, the opponent can switch out to reset their Speed drop at any time.

  • Iron Head allows Cinderace to boost its Defense with a powerful Max Steelspike while also hitting Grimmsnarl and Clefairy. Alternatively, Sucker Punch acts as both a priority option and a way to drop the foes' Special Defense with Max Darkness, which is quite appreciated by strong special attackers like Tapu Lele.

  • High Jump Kick pummels Incineroar and Porygon2 and also lets Cinderace negate Intimidate drops with Max Knuckle.

sets.name: G-Max Offensive
sets.description:
• With Steam Engine and an insane Gigantamax move in G-Max Volcalith, Coalossal threatens to become one of the fastest and most potent attackers in the metagame. When combined with a Surf user such as Dragapult or an Aqua Jet user such as Urshifu-R, Coalossal can easily maximize its Speed and gain a significant offensive boost from Weakness Policy.

  • Heat Wave is the Fire-type STAB move of choice due to it being a consistent spread move. It can also be used to set sun as Max Flare, which helps to mitigate Coalossal's otherwise severe weakness to Water. Said sun does remove Solar Beam's charge turn, but Solar Beam will usually be used as Max Overgrowth anyway.

  • Meteor Beam allows for the strongest G-Max Volcalith possible, which is the primary reason to run Coalossal thanks to its significant 1/6 damage to the targeted foe between turns.

  • Solar Beam via Max Overgrowth offers Coalossal a way through problematic Rock- and Water-types such as Regirock and Tapu Fini, as well as setting Grassy Terrain, lowering the power of incoming Earthquakes. Earth Power is responsible for beating threats such as opposing Coalossal and Nihilego while also boosting Coalossal's Special Defense with Max Quake.

  • 180 Speed EVs allow Coalossal to outspeed maximum Speed Venusaur in sun while at +6.

sets.name: Offensive Trick Room
sets.description:
• Being one of the slowest Pokemon in the current metagame with great Special Attack and a good offensive typing, Hatterene establishes itself as a good offensive Trick Room setter. Hatterene makes an ideal Dynamax candidate thanks to its G-Max Smite, which confuses both Pokemon on the enemy team, potentially making them waste a turn or more. Magic Bounce is very useful, as it bounces back status moves like Spore, Sleep Powder, Taunt, and Thunder Wave that would otherwise prevent Hatterene from setting up Trick Room.

  • Expanding Force is Hatterene's Psychic STAB move of choice, consistently dealing heavy damage to its foes when in Psychic Terrain. This makes Indeedee-F an ideal partner, as it sets Psychic Terrain and provides good support for Hatterene to set Trick Room up.

  • Dazzling Gleam gives Hatterene a strong option to hit Dark-types such as Urshifu-S, Incineroar and Grimmsnarl that are immune to Expanding Force. It also provides the base for G-Max Smite.

  • Mystical Fire allows Hatterene to overcome Steel-type threats that would otherwise check it, such as Metagross and Celesteela. It also provides a secondary effect of a Special Attack drop, which can be useful in reducing the damage of strong special attackers such as Spectrier and Regieleki.

  • Trick Room is an essential move on Hatterene, allowing it to take advantage of its base 29 Speed to underspeed notable base 30 Speed Pokemon, such as Amoonguss and Glastrier, other common Trick Room threats.

  • Magic Bounce is the optimal ability for Hatterene, as it prevents status moves that would deny it setting up Trick Room, such as Amoonguss's Spore and Taunt from Incineroar and Grimmsnarl. However, Magic Bounce presents an interesting interaction with Incineroar’s Parting Shot, which forces Hatterene to switch and prevents Incineroar’s pivoting.

sets.name: Screens Support
sets.description:
• Thanks to the combination of Prankster, workable natural bulk, and decent defensive typing, Grimmsnarl shines as a reliable dual screens setter that works well on balance teams. Its Dark / Fairy typing also makes it one of the best checks to Dragapult, in addition to letting it soft check Urshifu-S and Urshifu-R.

  • Spirit Break lets Grimmsnarl OHKO Urshifu-S and cripple special attackers like Spectrier, Porygon2, and Zapdos.

  • Both Reflect and Light Screen serve as fast and reliable damage reduction against powerful Dynamaxed attackers like Landorus-T and Regieleki. Reflect, in particular, is useful for holding strong against physical attackers that are immune to Intimidate, such as Metagross, Entei, and Mamoswine.

  • Fake Tears makes up for Grimmsnarl's relatively low offensive presence by powering up special attacking allies like Zapdos, Heatran, and Rotom-W. Thunder Wave and Scary Face let Grimmsnarl act as a means of speed control; Thunder Wave has the advantage of immobilizing foes, while Scary Face works on Electric- and Ground-type Pokemon as well as having perfect accuracy. Taunt is useful for shutting down other supportive Pokemon including Amoonguss, Porygon2, and Dusclops.

  • 212 EVs in both HP and Special Defense, along with a Careful nature, let Grimmsnarl survive Life Orb and Helping Hand boosted Spectrier Max Strike.

sets.name: Trick + Lagging Tail
sets.description:
• Spirit Break hits Fighting- and Dragon-type Pokemon like Urshifu-S, Dragapult, and Garchomp. The Special Attack drop is also useful for weakening the likes of Rotom-W, Spectrier, and Regieleki, as Spirit Break is Grimmsnarl's only means of damage reduction.

  • Fake Out can be used to grab early-game momentum alongside potent Dynamax partners like Zapdos and Spectrier. It is excellent to use against Pokemon that do not Dynamax often, such as Urshifu-S, Urshifu-R, and Whimsicott, as well as forcing certain Pokemon like Venusaur to Dynamax to avoid the flinch.

  • Trick combined with Lagging Tail is excellent for crippling opposing Pokemon under Dynamax, and it can steal useful items such as Weakness Policy and Life Orb. Grimmsnarl can repeatedly use Trick to further disrupt the opponent's item placement.

  • Fake Tears pairs well with special attackers like Celesteela and Regieleki, which can capitalize on the Special Defense drops. Taunt is nice for stopping Trick Room users such as Porygon2 and Dusclops.

  • The EV spread allows Grimmsnarl to always survive a Max Quake from Life Orb Landorus-T. The remaining Special Defense investment lets it safely survive a Max Ooze from unboosted Venusaur under Gigantamax.

Indeedee-F.overview: Indeedee-F stands out as the primary redirector of the current format with its access to Follow Me and other supportive options such as Helping Hand and Mystical Fire. Additionally, its automatic Psychic Terrain enables partner setup by preventing Fake Out. Indeedee-F's exclusively supportive role does make it dependent on its partner for offensive output, though, making big threats such as Spectrier and Rotom-H ideal next to it. Equally important, its Dark weakness is a liability due to threats such as Galarian Moltres and Urshifu-S being so common.

sets.name: Utility
sets.description:
• Expanding Force allows Indeedee-F to take advantage of its own Psychic Terrain with a fairly strong STAB spread move.

  • Follow Me is fantastic to allow partners like Porygon2 and Dusclops to consistently set up Trick Room or to support common setup sweepers such as Nasty Plot Spectrier and Swords Dance Landorus-T.

  • Helping Hand allows Indeedee-F to increase its partner's damage output, which compensates for its more supportive role.

  • Protect serves as Indeedee-F's primary form of longevity; however, Mystical Fire provides a nice coverage option for Fire weak Pokemon such as Kartana that also reduces the output of specially attacking threats such as Rotom-H and Tapu Fini.

  • Focus Sash is the preferred item for Indeedee-F to soak up one more hit while using Follow Me. Safety Goggles allows Indeedee-F to redirect disruptive powder moves such as Amoonguss's Spore and Venusaur's Sleep Powder. Colbur Berry can be opted for to both free up Focus Sash for a partner and survive moves such as Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow and Galarian Moltres's Max Darkness.

sets.name: Choiced Attacker
sets.description:
• Fishious Rend is the reason to use Dracovish. It is one of the strongest attacks in the metagame, easily OHKOing the likes of Incineroar, Nihilego, and Dynamaxed Landorus-T at doubled power.

  • Psychic Fangs is useful for hitting Amoonguss, which can redirect Fishious Rend. It can also shatter screens from Grimmsnarl or Gigantamax Lapras, which can be extremely useful for it and offensive partners like Zapdos and Cinderace.

  • Ice Fang lets Dracovish hit Water-resistant Pokemon like Rillaboom and Dragapult, though Crunch can be used for more damage on the latter.

  • Rock Slide allows Dracovish to fish for flinches in desperate situations, as it often moves first. Dragon Rush is Dracovish's best way to hit Dragon-types like opposing Dracovish and Kingdra, though its accuracy means it isn't extremely reliable.

  • Strong Jaw lets Dracovish get the most damage out of Fishious Rend, and typically it can afford to run Choice Scarf to outspeed Cinderace, Landorus-T, and Spectrier without relying on other means of speed control. Sand Rush sets are effective when paired with Tyranitar for an extremely useful Speed boost, as it can outspeed Pokemon like Dragapult and +1 Landorus-T, which Choice Scarf cannot do; however, Choice Band is the recommended item to make up for the lack of a Strong Jaw boost. It is worth noting that maximum invested Jolly Dracovish outspeeds Regieleki in sand, which Adamant fails to do.

sets.name: Substitute
sets.description:
• Fishious Rend is what makes Dracovish threatening. At full power, it is capable of OHKOing numerous Dynamaxed threats like Landorus-T and Charizard.

  • Ice Fang is the best complementary move to Fishious Rend, hitting common Water-resistant Pokemon like Dragapult, Venusaur, and Rillaboom for super effective damage.

  • Substitute is useful for keeping Dracovish safe from Intimidate and Fake Out, which are common methods used to check it.

  • Strong Jaw and Mystic Water are both important for ensuring Fishious Rend's damage output stays high, while 252 Speed EVs and a Jolly nature let it outspeed Modest Heatran.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Dragon Darts is a reliable spread move that can quickly transform into a powerful Max Wyrmwind, which is useful for dropping the Attack of prominent physical attackers like Glastrier, Kartana, and Landorus-T. Its smart targeting mechanic also means it is much harder to avoid by just using Protect or switching to a Fairy-type to absorb the hit.

  • Phantom Force is a strong Ghost-type STAB move that's nice for dodging opposing Max Moves thanks to its turn of invulnerability. Max Phantasm is excellent for stacking Defense drops, which partners like Kartana and Urshifu-S can take advantage of.

  • Fly is used for Max Airstream, which is Dragapult's most reliable method for handling fast threats. At +1 Speed, it can outspeed many common Pokemon such as Venusaur in sun.

  • Dragon Dance can turn Dragapult into an even more threatening sweeper, but it can be hard to pull off at times.

  • A Jolly nature allows Dragapult to outrun Spectrier and Tapu Koko. An Adamant nature can be used to drastically increase its damage output while still outspeeding Regieleki and Venusaur in sun after a Max Airstream.

  • Life Orb can be used for an immediate damage boost, but Weakness Policy drastically increases Dragapult's offensive prowess if it is activated.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• Supportive Dragapult is primarily used to activate Coalossal's Weakness Policy and Steam Engine with Surf. It can do this very effectively thanks to its high Speed, immunity to Fake Out, and excellent utility moves.

  • Breaking Swipe lowers both foes Attack stats, keeping Dragapult's partner safer from strong physical attackers like Landorus-T and Garchomp.

  • Surf is mandatory for being paired with Coalossal; specifically, it can circumvent redirection and is the weakest Water-type move Dragapult can use. It is important to keep in mind that Surf will do about 25% of Coalossal's health.

  • Light Screen lets Coalossal survive powerful Max Moves moves like Tapu Fini's Max Geyser and Heatran's Max Quake.

  • Ally Switch allows Dragapult to further support Coalossal by taking its place and stomaching hard-hitting Max Moves or potential double targets. Will-O-Wisp has the benefit of crippling physical attackers without triggering Defiant and Competitive users like Thundurus and Milotic.

  • Safety Goggles allows Dragapult to negate Venusaur's Sleep Powder so that it can get its Surf off. Focus Sash is useful for surviving strong hits like Spectrier's Max Phantasm; however, Colbur Berry can be used to survive a double target from Urshifu-S and another priority user like Rillaboom.

  • 252 Speed EVs and Jolly nature allow Dragapult to get its Surf off as fast as possible, notably outspeeding Spectrier. Additionally, a Jolly nature, combined with 0 Special Attack IVs, gives Dragapult the weakest possible Surf so that it does not significantly damage Coalossal.

Urshifu.overview: Urshifu-S is blessed with an amazing combination of STAB moves, a great Attack stat, and a good Speed tier that outspeeds many important Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Tapu Lele, and Rotom-W. Additionally, its Dark typing and access to Sucker Punch allow it to answer Dragapult and Spectrier effectively. Unseen Fist makes Urshifu very hard to check defensively by allowing it to hit through Protect, forcing the opponent to deal with it offensively. This allows it to thrive late-game when the opponent has already used up their Dynamax. However, Urshifu-S is held back by its low Special Defense and weaknesses to Flying- and Fairy-type attacks from the likes of Tapu Fini and Zapdos. It also suffers from a lack of flexibility, making it quite predictable; notably, it generally does not want to Dynamax, as it loses out on Wicked Blow's critical hits and Close Combat's Base Power.
Urshifu.comments:
Other Options

Iron Head is an option over Poison Jab to have a better Max Move. However, it fails to hit Tapu Fini and, as mentioned above, Urshifu usually does not want to Dynamax anyway. A Choice Scarf allows Urshifu to outspeed faster Pokemon such as Dragapult and +1 Speed Landorus-T, but this set is weak and very susceptible to being KOed quickly. Black Glasses is an option for boosting the power of Wicked Blow without the restrictions of Choice Band. U-turn can be used on the Choice Band set for pivoting, but it is generally not worth using over Sucker Punch or Poison Jab.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Wicked Blow's ability to bypass screens, Intimidate, and Defense boosts from Max Steelspike make Urshifu-S very hard to slow down. It is also a great tool against Pokemon such as Metagross and Dragapult.

  • Close Combat hits Dark- and Fighting-types such as Incineroar and Hitmontop that resist Wicked Blow, while also being great for hitting Porygon2.

  • Sucker Punch is excellent for removing faster threats, most notably Spectrier.

  • If Choice Band is not being used, Detect is preferred as the last move for protecting Urshifu-S from damage and conserving momentum, and it is run over Protect to bypass Imprison users such as Indeedee-M. With Choice Band, Poison Jab is used in order to deal heavy damage to the aforementioned Fairy-types.

  • Focus Sash is the most common item, mitigating Urshifu-S's poor bulk. However, Choice Band is worth considering because it makes Wicked Blow absurdly powerful, easily OHKOing Metagross and Porygon2. Black Glasses is an option for boosting the power of Wicked Blow without the restrictions of Choice Band.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Urshifu-R is a great offensive threat that can take advantage of its ability Unseen Fist, combined with its signature move Surging Strikes, to deal massive damage to foes. Urshifu-R's ability to break through Protect makes it great at maintaining offensive pressure. Urshifu-R is also an ideal partner to Coalossal, as its Aqua Jet can ensure you activate both Coalossal's Steam Engine and Weakness Policy.

  • Surging Strikes is a three-hit STAB move that can break bulky Pokemon through Defense boosts and Intimidate due to the guaranteed critical hit.

  • Aqua Jet can finish off weakened Pokemon running a Focus Sash such as Whimsicott, Raichu, and Regieleki.

  • Urshifu-R usually runs Focus Sash due to its poor Special Defense.

Regieleki.overview: With a ridiculous Speed stat, an incredible ability, and unmatched versatility, Regieleki has solidified itself as one of the most dominant forces in the metagame. Its wide range of possible sets allow it to fulfill a variety of roles, making it unpredictable at Team Preview. Regieleki's Max Lightning is also the strongest in the format, and is easily capable of zapping the likes of Celesteela, Galarian Moltres and Lapras. Unfortunately, Regieleki's lack of coverage makes it hard to hit common Ground-type Pokemon such as Landorus-T and Garchomp effectively. In addition, its poor defenses leave it vulnerable to any faster attacks, either from priority users such as Rillaboom or strong Pokemon in Tailwind such as Cinderace and Spectrier.
Regieleki.comments:
Other Options

Thunder works well when Regieleki is paired with Politoed thanks to it being 100% accurate in rain; on the other hand, Electro Ball can punish slow Trick Room setters such as Porygon2, Dusclops and Stakataka. However, it often means giving up Protect. Screech allows physically attacking partners such as Regirock and Metagross to hit for more damage. Regieleki can also choose to use a Choice Scarf to outspeed threats such as Venusaur in Sun, or Choice Specs to further improve its great offensive output.

sets.name: Special
sets.description:
• Electroweb provides speed control against fast threats such as Spectrier and Cinderace as well as giving Regieleki a somewhat strong spread move.

  • Volt Switch can deal decent damage while also serving as a fast and reliable pivoting option. Hyper Beam allows for Regieleki to hit Ground-types like Landorus-T and Garchomp with Max Strike, which also acts as speed control.

  • Magnet and Life Orb allow Regieleki to OHKO the likes of Galarian Moltres and Tapu Fini. Magnet is generally preferred unless Hyper Beam is run. Focus Sash can be used instead to increase Regieleki's survivability without running a dedicated support set.

sets.name: Physical
sets.description:
• Physical Regieleki aims to take advantage of the element of surprise, as most Regieleki are specially oriented. Regieleki's Transistor-boosted Wild Charge also preys on Pokemon that both are Electric-weak and have lower Defense than Special Defense,such as Tapu Fini and Galarian Moltres. This set is also much more willing to be Dynamaxed due to its better range of coverage.

  • Bounce is used for Max Airstream, and it serves to tackle common Flying-weak Pokemon such as Urshifu-S, Rillaboom, and Venusaur.

  • Assurance is a good coverage move that can hit Pokemon such as Spectrier and Dragapult for good damage. It also gives access to Max Darkness, dropping the opposing Pokemon's Special Defense for special attackers such as Galarian Moltres and Spectrier. Explosion is an option that provides a high Base Power option, and lowers the foe's Speed in Dynamax, and allows Regieleki to get one last powerful spread hit in before it goes down.

  • Electroweb is another option that offers a consistent form of speed control outside of Dynamax while also dealing substantially more damage to Pokemon with lower Special Defense, such as Torkoal, as Max Lightning than Wild Charge does.

  • Magnet is an alternate item option that is generally more potent when using Electroweb and Wild Charge on the same set. Focus Sash provides Regieleki some extra durability, allowing it to fire off more attacks when Dynamaxed rather than wasting its potential.

  • A Jolly nature is preferred when Regieleki is exclusively using physical moves; however, a Hasty nature is valid when using Electroweb, notably giving Regieleki a 50% chance to KO Torkoal with its special Max Lightning in Electric Terrain.

sets.name: Screens Support
sets.description:
• Electroweb grants speed control needed to maintain momentum against threats like Spectrier and Cinderace.

  • Thunderbolt hits for solid damage even without a boosting item thanks to Transistor. Volt Switch can help maintain momentum by safely pivoting into an ally with screens support.

  • Light Screen and Reflect help against Pokemon that otherwise threaten Regieleki such as Landorus-T, Rillaboom, and Garchomp while also providing security for its teammates.

  • Regieleki maximizes its Speed to ensure it can effectively set up screens. This EV spread allows Regieleki to survive strong hits such as Kartana's Max Overgrowth and Heatran's Max Quake through dual screens.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• With its Dragon-type moves only resisted by Steel and Fairy-types, Regidrago fills an interesting niche in the current metagame through sheer power. While it has a limited movepool, its Dragon's Maw-boosted Dragon-type moves let it break holes in opponents, with coverage moves like Ancient Power and Fire Fang being noticeably weaker in comparison.

  • Dragon Energy is the strongest Dragon-type move in Series 9 when Regidrago is at full HP. Even against Steel-types that would otherwise take little damage from like Metagross and Celesteela Dragon Energy cuts their HP by one third, typically more than a super effective coverage move would have. However, Dragon Energy decreases in power as Regidrago loses HP, so it is most reliable to use when it can move before the opponent. Additionally, when Dynamaxed, Dragon Energy's Base Power is fixed at its maximum.

  • Draco Meteor serves as a powerful secondary STAB move for Regidrago. While only hitting one opponent, Draco Meteor's Base Power does not decrease as Regidrago's HP falls, providing an alternative option to Dragon Energy.

  • Dragon Pulse gives Regidrago a STAB move with no drawback. With a naturally high HP stat and resistances to Fire, Water, Grass, and Electric, Regidrago can stay on the field and take a few hits, letting it take advantage of its relative longevity and keep up the offensive pressure.

  • Hyper Beam hits opposing Fairy-types such as Tapu Fini and Grimmsnarl, allowing Regidrago to break through them. Regidrago would prefer that its teammates handle Fairy-types, but in a pinch, Hyper Beam lets it deal with those threats along with providing speed control through a powerful Max Strike. Protect shields Regidrago from incoming damage, allowing its Dragon Energy to stay as powerful as possible.

  • Choice Scarf lets Regidrago outrun a lot of the metagame, letting it unleash Dragon Energy at full power before its HP decreases. With forms of speed control such as Tailwind and Electroweb, Dragon Fang boosts Regidrago's Dragon-type moves even further and lets it switch attacks, which is useful when Dragon Energy becomes weaker than Dragon Pulse.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Icicle Crash is preferred as it has a chance to land a timely flinch, though Icicle Spear has the notable advantages of perfect accuracy and the ability to break through a Focus Sash. It is worth noting that both attacks have the same Base Power for Max Hailstorm.

  • High Horsepower pairs perfectly with Glastrier's STAB move allowing it to hit Incineroar, Entei, and Heatran for solid damage. Max Quake is excellent for boosting its Special Defense and allowing it to match up better against Tapu Fini and Spectrier.

  • Close Combat gives a higher damage output option for Incineroar and Porygon2 while also letting Glastrier boost its Attack with Max Knuckle.

  • Heavy Slam can be used to hit Fairy-types such as Grimmsnarl and Clefairy while also boosting Glastrier's Defense with Max Steelspike, letting it stand up to Urshifu-S and Urshifu-R much more easily.

  • Life Orb can be used for an immediate boost to its damage output, but this makes it more susceptible to Intimidate and compromises its bulk. Lum Berry lets Glastrier set up Swords Dance in the face of Amoonguss and attack through Venusaur's Sleep Powder. Assault Vest Glastrier is an amazing option for walling strong special attackers including Spectrier and Regieleki.

Spectrier.overview: Sporting a spectacular base 145 Special Attack and impressive base 130 Speed, Spectrier offers a blend of utility and offense that has proven its worth in the current metagame on a variety of team compositions. Spectrier also has a wondrous signature ability in Grim Neigh, which boosts its Special Attack by one stage for each KO it gets, allowing it to become increasingly volatile the longer it is in play. However, Spectrier does lack strong coverage options outside of Ghost-type attacks. While the metagame does host a series of strong Dark-type Pokemon capable of dispatching or outright walling Spectrier, it is still a force to be reckoned with.
Spectrier.comments:
Other Options

Dark Pulse can be used to hit Indeedee-F and lower foes' Special Defense with Max Darkness. Haze is an option for fighting teams that spam stat reduction.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Hyper Beam provide Spectrier with speed control when Dynamaxed through Max Strike while also allowing it to hit Dark-type Pokemon such as Incineroar, Galarian Moltres, and Urshifu-S.

  • Mud Shot offers Spectrier a way to boost its Special Defense with Max Quake and also has the added benefit of doing increased damage to Steel- and Fire-type Pokemon like Heatran and Incineroar.

  • Nasty Plot is an option for teams that have strong forms of redirection, which enables Spectrier to safely boost its Special Attack.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• Will-O-Wisp lets Spectrier cripple physical attackers such as Garchomp, Landorus-T, and Thundurus that a partner such as Metagross may struggle to deal with effectively.

  • Bulldoze is an amazing option for Weakness Policy users such as Metagross and Regirock while also providing speed control. Snarl gives Spectrier strong utility for weakening foes while also being a strong option to boost its own damage output with Max Darkness.

  • Taunt allows Spectrier to prevent Trick Room strategies and cripple the likes of Amoonguss and Porygon2.

  • Safety Goggles is an amazing item that lets Spectrier safely lead into status-inducing leads and teams that rely on Rage Powder for redirection. Colbur Berry can give Spectrier the ability to tank a Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S outside of Dynamax or even Max Darkness from Galarian Moltres.

  • 252 HP EVs paired with 44 Defense EVs are enough for Spectrier to survive a Choice Band Rillaboom's Grassy Glide. The Special Defense investment lets Spectrier tank +2 Max Geyser from Rotom-W. 156 Speed EVs with a Timid nature allow Spectrier to outspeed maximum Speed Regieleki when its Speed is reduced by one stage.
